TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCActionTween extends Cocos2D.CCActionInterval

Docs.remarks: <para> <verbatim>ActionTween </verbatim> </para><verbatim>ActionTween </verbatim><para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /> is an action that lets you update any property of an object. For example, if you want to modify the "width" property of a target from 200 to 300 in 2 seconds, then:</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /><para>id modifyWidth = [<see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /> actionWithDuration:2 key:"width" from:200 to:300]; [target runAction:modifyWidth];</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /><para>Another example: <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScaleTo" /> action could be rewritten using PropertyAction:</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScaleTo" /><para>scaleA and scaleB are equivalents id scaleA = [<see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScaleTo" /> actionWithDuration:2 scale:3]; id scaleB = [<see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /> actionWithDuration:2 key:"scale" from:1 to:3];</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCScaleTo" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCActionTween" /><para> <para>v0.99.2 </para> </para><para>v0.99.2 </para><para>v0.99.2 </para>

Docs.summary: called before the action start. It will also set the target.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Update(float32 dt) cil managed

Docs.summary: called once per frame. time a value between 0 and 1
Docs.remarks: <para>called once per frame. time a value between 0 and 1</para><para>For example:<list type="bullet"><item><description>0 means that the action just started</description></item><item><description>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</description></item><item><description>1 means that the action is over </description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>0 means that the action just started</description> </item> <item> <description>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</description> </item> <item> <description>1 means that the action is over </description> </item> </list><para>0 means that the action just started</para><para>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</para><para>1 means that the action is over </para>
